intro: Lueheopsis hoehnei, commonly known as the Hoehne's lueheopsis, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, palmate leaves and produces delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern. Its botanical study offers insights into the adaptive strategies of plants in extreme environments.
